definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: impurity (as abhorrent, shunned);—abs. ´[[נ]] Ez Eze 18:6 +; cstr. [[נִדַּת]] Le 12:2 +; sf. [[נִדָּתָהּ]] v:Le 12:5 +;—impurity (esp. P and Ezek.):

of ceremonial impurity, as union with brother's wife, Le 20:21; esp. of menstruation Ez Eze 18:6 (rd. [[אִשָּׁה בְּנִדָּתָהּ]] for MT [[נִדָּה]] ´[[א]] SyrVer Co), ´[[טְמֵאַת הַנּ]] Eze 22:10, cf. Eze 36:17, [[נִדַּת דְּוֹתָהּ]] Le 12:2, cf. v:Le 12:5, Le 15:19, Le 15:20, Le 15:24, Le 15:25 (´[[עֶת־נִדּ]]), v:Le 15:25, v:Le 15:25, v:Le 15:26 (´[[מִשְׁכַּב נִדּ]]), v:Le 15:26 (´[[טֻמְאַת נִדּ]]), v:Le 15:33, Le 18:19; of defilement contracted by contact with a corpse, [[נִּדָּה]]([[הַ]])[[מֵי ]] water of impurity (i.e. to remove it, cf. Di) Nu 19:9, Nu 19:13, Nu 19:20, Nu 19:21, Nu 19:21, Nu 31:23.

fig. (with allusion to cerem. usage), impure thing, Ez Eze 7:19, Eze 7:20 (of gold), La 1:17 (of Jerus.); of idolatry, immorality, etc., 2Ch 29:5, Ezr 9:11 ([[אֶרֶץ נִדָּה]]), v:Ezr 9:11, Zec 13:1 ([[לְחַטַּאת וּלְנִדָּה]]).
